001package org.consensusj.daemon.micronaut;
002
003import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Context;
004import io.micronaut.http.MediaType;
005import io.micronaut.http.annotation.Body;
006import io.micronaut.http.annotation.Controller;
007import io.micronaut.http.annotation.Post;
008import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcRequest;
009import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcResponse;
010import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcService;
011import org.slf4j.Logger;
012import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
013
014import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
015
016/**
017 * Create a REST endpoint from a JsonRpcService
018 * Here we're using Micronaut annotations to wrap the JsonRpcService
019 * in an HTTP environment and to serialize JSON to and from Java POJOs.
020 */
021@Controller("/")
022@Context
023public class JsonRpcController {
024    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(JsonRpcController.class);
025    private final JsonRpcService jsonRpcService;
026
027    public JsonRpcController(WalletAppKitJsonRpcService walletAppKitService) {
028        log.info("Constructing JsonRpcController");
029        jsonRpcService = walletAppKitService;
030    }
031
032    @Post(produces = MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
033    public CompletableFuture<JsonRpcResponse<Object>> index(@Body JsonRpcRequest req) {
034        log.info("JSON-RPC call: {}", req.getMethod());
035        return jsonRpcService.call(req);
036    }
037
038}
